data.title: Average at best, way too expensive
data.text: The food is very, very average.  Not impressed at all at the flavors or portions.  What was impressive was how much money they charged.  Don't waste your time at this one people.

data.title: Excellent Thai
data.text: Chicken Satay was exceptional as was their duck.  Very casual serving local college students and downtown crowd.  Reasonable pricing.  Ben gave great service and is knowledgeable of the food.  His suggestions were spot on!

data.title: Extremely long wait
data.text: Three of us chose to eat here for lunch. Our orders were simple.....after one and a half hour wait we inquired about our order and we're told it would be another 30 minutes. Two of our party decided to eat from buffet instead of wait for their order. I hate ordered egg rolls and wonton soup so I stuck with my order thinking it wouldn't be long. 20 minutes later finally. Food was very average.  Will not try again.

data.title: We Keep Going Back
data.text: We like Sawatdee for the very good service and good food. If you like Thai and are in St. Cloud this is the only option.

data.title: Nice place and good food
data.text: Very good and quite reasonable. Wanted to eat at the White Horse across the street but it was crowded and noisy. Fast service and no hard liqour but every thing was fresh and tasty.

data.title: Only option for Thai food in Central MN
data.text: For Thai food in Central Minnesota, Sawatdee is the only option. Luckily, the food here is authentic and it is also very good. Make sure you try the Spring Rolls with beef as they are delicious!

data.title: Not a good dinner by Thai Standards
data.text: We were greeted by a young woman with flaming red hair.  I think we were bothering her.  The spring rolls were pretty good bu not hot clear through.  When the Pad Thai and Thai Fried Rice arrived were were disappointed with the appearance.  The rice was wet with a brown gravy of some sort and not a faint red colored rice we were used to at Thai Restaurants. The Pad Thai was swimming in this same brown gravy which tasted like watered down beef gravy.  There was nothing fresh about any of the food and my wife thought that the food appeared to be left overs from the lunch buffet.  We had eaten at the Sawatdee in Minneapolis years ago and it was pretty good.  This experience was anything but good.

data.title: Spring rolls are a must!
data.text: Fast service, fresh delicious food.  Fantastic authentic Thai in central Minnesota.  The spring rolls and peanut sauce is fantastic!  The wings are highly recommended.  Large portions great for sharing or taking home for a second meal.  Enjoy Sawatdee!

data.title: hot and tasty chicken
data.text:
always hot tasty chicken with very good sides.
average decor but lots of windows.
clean restrooms. buffet has various very good items. good salads as well.

data.title: Food, yum! Atmosphere...meh.
data.text:
I do love the food here, minus the msg. The atmosphere and the place itself could do well with an overhaul. It feels dirty, but that might be because nothing in the place matches, or makes sense..? Weird trinkets, wall hangings, colors, etc.
But again...I go for the food and that's worth going for.

data.title: Do we have that knd of time?
data.text:
I love the Sawatdee restaurant. The food is always delicious and the large picture windows offer a great view of one of the main streets in town.  We visit there about once a month. 

The last time I was there I had the spicy noodles with chicken. It was tasty. Spiciness can be a little on the hot side, so if you fear hot spicy food go for the mild settings. I like their "medium". If you get the chance to visit Sawatdee, be sure to have an egg roll. There are none better in the land. 

The drawback to the dining experience is the slow service. The staff is always friendly enough, but they are often scarce when water glasses are empty or it you may need a second napkin. We have learned to plan ahead and ask ourselves if we have that kind of time to spend for  dinner. Figure an hour minimum if you are lucky, but more likely 90 minutes plus.  

The food is well worth the wait, but you need to have the time.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: I enjoyed a Delicious lunch buffet here for $7.95!  There was a wonderful light soup; thin crusting on the fried spring roll with tasty sweet 'n sour sauce; a lovely curry with nice amount of spice; tasty tofu and vegetable dish; a wonderful Thai iced coffee and great service!  I overheard the young men at the next booth saying, "Isn't that the smallest buffet you've ever seen?"  I would agree that it was small, but it was very well done!  (I have had some very large buffets before that were not that good).  I would rather have delicious food and wonderful service instead of a large selection of not-so-good items.

data.title: Yummy Thai food!
data.text: I enjoyed a delicious lunch buffet here for $7.95!  There was a wonderful light soup; thin crusting on the fried spring roll with tasty sweet ' n sour sauce; a lovely curry with a nice amount of spice; tasty tofu and vegetable dish; a wonderful Thai iced coffee and great service!  I overheard some young men at the next booth saying, "Isn't that the smallest buffet you've ever seen?"  I would agree that it was small, but it was very well done!  (I have had some very large buffets before that were not that good).

data.title: Enjoyable meal
data.text: Ate there on a early saturday evening. The wait staff were friendly and attentive. I had the mince beef laab (minced beef salad), an order of sticky rice and a thai iced coffee. My dining companion had the chicken with cashew nuts. The laab was perfectly seasoned, just enough chili to accentuate the sourness of the lime juice and pungency of the fish sauce. It was served with lettuce leaves to scoop with, the traditional way  to eat it. The sticky rice was perfectly sticky and a nice contrast to the sour,salty,sweet and bitter flavours that make up Thai cuisine. I am hoping to go back and eat another meal there before traveling back to Iowa.

data.title: Great food
data.text: Authentic and tasty food in an atmosphere a step up from the usual Asian cafe. Everyone in our family thought there food was great.

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: The beauty of Thai food is freshness. We did not find that here. The fresh spring rolls were a bit dry like they had been sitting around for a little while. Our table ordered up three different curries. Two were a little short on fresh vegetables. The rice was cold. The massman had way too many peanuts in it although the sauce was tasty. It was a bit on the cold side but the beef was tender.  So close but not quite there. Service was a little slow as they were unaware of a show at the nearby Paramount Theater and were understaffed both in the kitchen and only had one servers. I found that odd. I don't enjoy writing an unfavorable review but this place used to have a good reputation.  Supenn (if she still owns it) would not be happy.

data.title: Not coming back
data.text: It was edible and for a town with a lack of variety i guess it helps to switch things up. food was sloppy and curry was just okay, spring rolls were just stuffed with lettuce that came with a salad bag. The interior was fairly unpleasant and we stopped looking around after a fairly short while. Not going back...

data.title: Good Food, bad service
data.text: Most of the food here is good. Sometimes the hostess and the wait staff are slow and snotty. The decor is sad and hasn't been updated in over a decade. I recommend take out.

data.title: Very lack of proffessionalism and customer Service.
data.text: Wait staff need alot of training with Ettiquette! I was waiting for my to go, theres a wall that separates the front where you come in they wouldnt noticed you. I can hear the wait staff gossiping of home life while another customer was waiting for their to go also. I can hear on the otherside of the wall the waitress being very loud and humiliating these guys at a table and trying to pay their bills and one of them said,"And she's a waitress?" Someone from another Sawatdee should show them proper customer service.

data.title: Good curry
data.text: Came here with others for lunch buffet but I ordered off the menu and tried the green curry with tofu.  It was quite good although maybe not as good as the now defunct Asia House's green curry as it really only had green peppers with a few carrots and pea pods in it. More veggies overall would make it great.  Others really liked the buffet which was very heavy on chicken dishes.
